column1: '''Esgalduin''' was a major tributary of the [[Sirion]]
column2: which rose in the dark heights of the [[Ered Gorgoroth]] from the [[Shadowy Spring]]
column3: and flowed southwestward to meet the Sirion on the western borders of [[Doriath]]. It marked the boundary between the forests of [[Forest of Neldoreth|Neldoreth]] and [[Forest of Region|Region]].

column1: In a manuscript dating from the late 1950s and early 1960s
column2: [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] wrote that  ''Esgalduin'' is a [[Sindarin]] name meaning "the river under shade".<ref>{{PE|17}}
the name ''Esgalduin'' was said to be [[Ilkorin]] for "River under Veil (of [?leaves])"
